meanings.definition: A person or thing that classifies or categorizes.
meanings.sent1: The librarian is one of the classers at the library, organizing books by genre.
meanings.sent2: The classers in the recycling plant separate paper, plastic, and glass for recycling.
meanings.sent3: The classers at the zoo had a tough time deciding if the new animal belonged in the mammal or reptile category.
meanings.sent4: She was like a classer of emotions, neatly sorting through her feelings one by one.
meanings.sent5: The teacher acted as a classer, assigning students to different groups based on their skills.

meanings.definition: Plural form of classer, referring to multiple individuals or things that classify or categorize.
meanings.sent1: The team of classers worked together to organize the documents in the filing cabinet.
meanings.sent2: The classers in the lab labeled the test tubes with precision and accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The classers at the office party hilariously tried to group people based on their favorite type of music.
meanings.sent4: The classers of the forest, the ants, diligently sorted and stored food for the winter.
meanings.sent5: The group of classers efficiently sorted the products into different categories for the inventory.
